definition: old but vigorous (idiom); hale and hearty despite the years

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
benefit/profit/advantage/beneficial/to increase/to add/all the more
surname Yi
Zhuang ethnic group of Guangxi, the PRC's second most numerous ethnic group
to strengthen/strong/robust

sentences.english: I must say again that I heartily admire your gallantry and youthfulness.
sentences.chinese: 我必須再說一遍，我衷心佩服你老當益壯的俠義精神。

sentences.english: How I admire the gallantry of your youthful spirit, Mr. Lorry.
sentences.chinese: 我真佩服你老當益壯的俠義精神，羅瑞先生。

sentences.english: Oh, he's a real spring chicken, always full of energy .
sentences.chinese: 喔，他可真是個老當益壯的人，永遠充滿活力呢。

definition: running as fast as flying
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations
high-spirited/full of mettle
old and gray-haired
indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
in one's prime
upright and plainspoken
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
penniless
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
can't be bought for one thousand in gold (idiom)
empty-handed (idiom); fig. not receiving anything
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
